document.addEventListener("DOMContentLoaded", (event) => {
	let infoBannerId=document.getElementById('rich-text-39056285-933b-4c4c-87e8-29bdbecb5f90');
	if (infoBannerId) 
	{
		document.body.classList.add('has-info-banner');
		addEventListener("scroll", (event) => { 
			if (window.scrollY>50) document.body.classList.remove('has-info-banner'); 
			else document.body.classList.add('has-info-banner');
		});
	}

	if (inJournalScope())
		initJournalDfp();
	else if (inMicrositeScope()) 
		initMicrositeDfp();
	else 
		initGlobalDfp();
});

<script defer src="https://static.cloudflareinsights.com/beacon.min.js/v84a3a4012de94ce1a686ba8c167c359c1696973893317" integrity="sha512-euoFGowhlaLqXsPWQ48qSkBSCFs3DPRyiwVu3FjR96cMPx+Fr+gpWRhIafcHwqwCqWS42RZhIudOvEI+Ckf6MA==" data-cf-beacon='{"rayId":"862d15dd58e0eeb8","version":"2024.2.4","token":"fa0710f1386f47618f0d7685b0e0d4a3"}' crossorigin="anonymous" nonce="9b7d0f73982899df-SJC"></script>




<!-- loading Javascript for using the persistence Service -->
    <script src="/wro/d6ea3c9cf483d863939617799673519f96fad177~thiss-ds.js" async nonce="9b7d0f73982899df-SJC"></script>

    <script type="text/javascript" nonce="9b7d0f73982899df-SJC">

        var SeamlessAccessService = {
            spUrl: "/action/ssostart",
            


    
        returnURL: "/doi/abs/10.1177/02762366211019782",
    
    


            my_context: 'seamlessaccess.org',
            timeout: 5000,
            _persistenceService: null,
            _getPersistenceService: function () {
                if (!this._persistenceService) {
                    this._persistenceService = new thiss.PersistenceService('https://service.seamlessaccess.org/ps/');
                }
                return this._persistenceService;
            },

            getWAYFLessUrl: function (entityId) {
                return this.spUrl + "?idp=" + encodeURIComponent(entityId)
                    + "&redirectUri=" + encodeURIComponent(this.returnURL);
            },
            retrieveEntity: function (ms) {
                var self = this;
                var persistService = this._getPersistenceService();

                if (ms == undefined || ms === '') {
                    ms = this.timeout;
                }

                return new Promise(function (resolve, reject) {
                    persistService.entities(self.my_context)
                        .then(function (res) {
                            return resolve(res.data);
                        }, function (err) {
                            // failed
                            reject('failed to retrieve entity from local storage: ' + err);
                        });
                    // Set up the timeout
                    setTimeout(function () {
                        reject('Promise timed out ' + ms + ' ms');
                    }, ms);
                });
            },
            updateEntity: function (entitydata) {
                var self = this;
                var persistService = this._getPersistenceService();

                var jsonObj = {};
                try {
                    //try to parse it, if it is a json string
                    jsonObj = JSON.parse(entitydata.val());
                } catch (e) {
                    jsonObj = entitydata;
                }
                return new Promise(function (resolve, reject) {
                    persistService.update(self.my_context, jsonObj)
                        .then(function (res) {
                            // Process the results
                            var ssoInstitutions = res.data;
                            return resolve(ssoInstitutions);
                        }, function (err) {
                            // failed
                            console.log('failed to update the local storage due to: ' + err);
                            reject(err);
                        });
                })
            },
            removeEntity: function (entityId) {
                var self = this;
                var persistService = this._getPersistenceService();

                return new Promise(function (resolve) {
                    persistService.remove(self.my_context, entityId)
                        .then(function (res) {
                            return resolve(res);
                        }, function (err) {
                            // failed
                            console.log('failed to remove from local storage duo to: ' + err);
                        });
                })
            },
            getAccessibleEntityStatus: function (doi, entityId, entityTitle) {
                return new Promise(function (resolve, reject) {
                    $.ajax({
                        type: 'POST',
                        url: '/action/seamlessAccess',
                        accept: {
                            text: "application/json"
                        },
                        data: {
                            doi: doi,
                            entityid: entityId,
                            entityTitle: entityTitle,
                            eventGroupKey: '05f01335-e148-4b78-ad9c-ea6894106b46'
                        }

                    }).done(function (status) {
                        return resolve(status);
                    }).fail(function (status) {
                        return reject(status);
                    });
                });
            },
            getEntitiesWithAllInfo: function (doi) {
                let self = this,
                    arrayOfPromises = [];
                return new Promise(function (resolve, reject) {
                    self.retrieveEntity().then(function (res) {
                        let allSsoInstitutions = res;
                        for (i = 0; i < allSsoInstitutions.length; i++) {
                            let ssoInstitution = allSsoInstitutions[i];
                            arrayOfPromises.push(new Promise(function (resolve) {
                                self.getAccessibleEntityStatus(doi, ssoInstitution.entity.entityID, ssoInstitution.entity.title)
                                    .then(function (entityStatus) {
                                        resolve({
                                            entityID: ssoInstitution.entity.entityID,
                                            entityTitle: ssoInstitution.entity.title,
                                            entityStatusObj: entityStatus,
                                            entitySsoUrl: self.getWAYFLessUrl(ssoInstitution.entity.entityID)
                                        });
                                    }, function (err) {
                                        console.log('failed to get the entity status: ' + ssoInstitution.entity.entityID,err);
                                    });
                            }));
                        }
                        if(allSsoInstitutions.length === 0 && false){
                            self.getAccessibleEntityStatus(doi, null, null)
                                .then(function () {
                                    console.log('No Entity found');
                                }, function (err) {
                                    console.log('failed to get the none entity status' ,err);
                                });
                        }
                        Promise.all(arrayOfPromises)
                            .then(function (finalResponse) {
                                resolve(finalResponse);
                            }).catch(function (err) {
                                reject(err);
                            });

                    }).catch(function (err) {
                        reject(err);
                    })
                });
            }
        };

        window.addEventListener('load', function () {
            document.querySelectorAll(".sso-institution").forEach(function (institution) {
                var entityId = institution.getAttribute('data-entityid');
                var entityName = institution.getAttribute('data-name');
                var entitydata = {
                    entityID: entityId,
                    title: entityName
                };
                institution.addEventListener("click", function (e) {
                    e.preventDefault();

                    if ($('.institution-preference-userconsent-checkbox').length > 0) {
                        let institutionPreferenceUserConsentCheckbox = $('.institution-preference-userconsent-checkbox').get(0);
                        if (!$(institutionPreferenceUserConsentCheckbox).is(":checked")) {
                            return;
                        }
                    }

                    var self = this;
                    SeamlessAccessService.updateEntity(entitydata).then(function (res) {
                        console.log(res);
                        window.location.href = self.href;
                    }).catch(function (err) {
                        window.location.href = self.href;
                    });
                });
            });
        });

    </script>

    <script src="//scholar.google.com/scholar_js/casa.js" async nonce="9b7d0f73982899df-SJC"></script>

        </head>

class="meta-panel__right-content"></div></div><h1 property="name">The Effect of Fantasy Context on Moral Action and Judgment</h1><div class="contributors"><span class="authors"><span role="list"><span href="/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection#bad8c8d3dbd4c8cfdfded3d4dddfc8faddd7dbd3d694d9d5d7" property="email" aria-label="Email address"><span class="__cf_email__" data-cfemail="8be9f9e2eae5f9feeeefe2e5eceef9cbece6eae2e7a5e8e4e6">[email&#160;protected]</span></a></span> and <span property="author" typeof="Person" role="listitem"><a href="#con2"><span id="abstracts" data-extent="frontmatter"><div class="core-container"><section id="abstract" property="abstract" typeof="Text" role="doc-abstract"><h2 property="name">Abstract</h2><div role="paragraph">Research suggests individuals import real-world facts into fictional worlds based on the type of fact and fictional context. We examined the importation of real-world morality across fictional contexts. Undergraduate (Study 1) and MTurk (Study 2) participants were randomly assigned to read either a realistic or matching fantastical interactive narrative. At seven junctions, participants were presented with a choice between behaving morally and behaving immorally to advance their goals. In Study 3, an MTurk sample judged the actions of a character who behaved immorally. For Study 1, a gender by condition interaction was found, with males electing more immoral actions in the fantasy condition. For Study 2, no such effect was found. Nonetheless, in Study 3, participants judged immoral actions in the realistic condition as more immoral compared to the fantasy context. Across all studies, transportation predicted choosing fewer immoral actions and judging immoral actions more harshly.</div></section></div></div><section id="bodymatter" data-extent="bodymatter" property="articleBody" typeof="Text"><div class="core-container"><section aria-labelledby="denial-block-title" class="denial-block "><i class="icon-lock-alt d-lg-none"><span class="path1"></span><span class="path2"></span><span class="path3"></span><span class="path4"></span></i><h2 id="denial-block-title" class="denial-block__title">Get full access to this article</h2><p class="denial-block__text">View all access and purchase options for this article.</p><div class="denial-block__cta"><a href="#core-collateral-purchase-access" class="btn btn-primary"><span>Get Access</span><i aria-hidden="true" class="icon-lock_closed_not_fill"></i></a></div></section></div></section><section id="backmatter" data-extent="backmatter"><div class="core-container"><section id="bibliography" role="doc-bibliography"><h2>References</h2><div role="list"><div role="listitem"><div id="bibr1-02762366211019782" class="citations"><div class="citation"><div class="citation-content">Aquino K., Reed I. In addition to studying the cognitive science of fiction and imagination, she is also a New York Times bestselling novelist. Her research focuses on the impacts of engaging with fiction, the limits of the imagination, and the psychology of fandom.</div></div></section><section id="supplementary-materials" class="core-supplementary-materials"><h2>Supplementary Material</h2><p>Please find the following supplemental material available below.</p><p>For Open Access articles published under a <a href="https://creativecommons.org/licenses/">Creative Commons License</a>, all supplemental material carries the same license as the article it is associated with.</p><p>For non-Open Access articles published, all supplemental material carries a non-exclusive license, and permission requests for re-use of supplemental material or any part of supplemental material shall be sent directly to the copyright owner as specified in the copyright notice associated with the article.</p><div role="list"><div class="core-supplementary-material" role="listitem"><div class="core-link"><ul><li><a href="/doi/suppl/10.1177/02762366211019782/suppl_file/sj-pdf-1-ica-10.1177_02762366211019782.pdf" download="sj-pdf-1-ica-10.1177_02762366211019782.pdf"><i class="icon-download-outline" aria-hidden="true"></i><span class="core-filename">sj-pdf-1-ica-10.1177_02762366211019782.pdf</span></a></li><li>1.35 MB</li></ul></div></div></div></section></div></section></div><div class="core-collateral" role="dialog" aria-modal="true"><div id="core-collateral-self-citation" aria-expanded="false"><header><h2><i class="icon-cite" aria-hidden="true"></i>Cite</h2></header><h3>Cite</h3><div class="section--wrapper"><section>

                adBlockerPresent: true,
                reason: '',
                dataLayer: null,
                run: function() {
                    this.dataLayer = window.dataLayer || [];

                        if ($('#ad-blocker-test-image').is(':visible')) {
                            this.adBlockerPresent = false;
                        }
                        else {
                            this.reason = '(image block)';
                        }
                    }
                    else {
                        this.reason = '(script block)';
                    }
                    console.log('Blocking Ads: ' + (this.adBlockerPresent ? 'Yes ' : 'No ') + this.reason);
                    let index = this.dataLayer.findIndex(item => item.site);
                    if (index !== -1) {
                        dataLayer[index].site.ad_blocker = this.adBlockerPresent
                    }
                    window.dataLayer = this.dataLayer;
                }
            }
            adBlockerTracker.run();
        }
    }

<script>
const setVWOConsentState = (state) => {
    window.VWO = window.VWO || [];
    window.VWO.init = window.VWO.init ||
        function (state) {
            window.VWO.consentState = state;
        };
    console.log('setting vwo consent state', state);
    window.VWO.init(state);
};
const updateVWOStatusGDPR = () => {
  const cmpConsentStatus = window?.__cmp('consentStatus');
  const consentExists = cmpConsentStatus?.consentExists;
  const cmpData = window?.__cmp('getCMPData');
  const vwoVendorId = 's31';

  if (consentExists) {
    if (cmpData?.vendorConsents?.[vwoVendorId]) {
      setVWOConsentState(1);
    } else {
      setVWOConsentState(3);
    }
  } else {
    setVWOConsentState(2);
  }
};

if (window.needsCmp === true) {
    const checkCmpAndAddListener = () => {
        if (window.__cmp) {
            window.__cmp('addEventListener', ['consent', updateVWOStatusGDPR, false], null);
                        updateVWOStatusGDPR();
            return true;
        }
        return false;
    };
    if (!checkCmpAndAddListener()) {
        const cmpCheckInterval = setInterval(() => {
            if (checkCmpAndAddListener()) {
                clearInterval(cmpCheckInterval);
            }
        }, 100);
                setTimeout(() => {
            clearInterval(cmpCheckInterval);
        }, 10000);
    }
} else {
        setVWOConsentState(1);
}
</script>

              <script>
(function() {
  // Make these global as plausible uses them
  window.getCookie = function(name) {
    const value = `; ${document.cookie}`;
    const parts = value.split(`; ${name}=`);
    if (parts.length === 2) return parts.pop().split(';').shift();
  }
  window.setCookie = function(name, value, days, isSecure) {
    const d = new Date();
    d.setTime(d.getTime() + 24 * 60 * 60 * 1000 * days);
    let cookieStr = name + "=" + value + ";path=/;SameSite=Lax;expires=" + d.toGMTString();
    if (isSecure) {
      cookieStr += ";secure";
    }
    document.cookie = cookieStr;
  }

  try {
    let mw8hxid = getCookie('mw8hxid');
    if (!mw8hxid) {
      mw8hxid = Math.random().toString().slice(2, 21);
      setCookie('mw8hxid', mw8hxid, 365, window.mwdata && window.mwdata.ENV !== 'sandbox');
    }

    const consumerPercent = parseInt(mw8hxid.slice(-2), 10);

    if (window.mwdata && Array.isArray(window.mwdata.AB_C_EXPERIMENTS)) {
      const exps = {};
      for (const exp of window.mwdata.AB_C_EXPERIMENTS) {
        if (consumerPercent >= exp.percentages_start && consumerPercent < exp.percentages_end) {
          exps[exp.ab_exp_name] = exp.ab_leg;
        }
      }

      if (Object.keys(exps).length > 0) {
        window.dataLayer = window.dataLayer || [];
        window.dataLayer.push({
          event: 'internalAbSetUserProperties',
          user_properties: exps
        });

        // Let's also make AB legs available as js variables
        window.mwdata.int_ab_exps = exps;
      } else {
        if (typeof Sentry !== 'undefined' && typeof Sentry.captureMessage === 'function') {
          Sentry.captureMessage('err: mwdata.AB_C_EXPERIMENTS, exps are empty');
        }
      }
    } else {
      if (typeof Sentry !== 'undefined' && typeof Sentry.captureMessage === 'function') {
        Sentry.captureMessage('err: mwdata.AB_C_EXPERIMENTS are not found');
      }
    }
  } catch (e) {
    if (typeof Sentry !== 'undefined' && typeof Sentry.captureException === 'function') {
      Sentry.captureException(e);
    }
  }
})();
</script>

  if (window.mwdata.importModules === undefined) {
    window.mwdata.importModules  = [];

    menu.gamesSubmenuOpen = false;

        <div class="left-content col position-relative overflow-hidden" id="left-content" data-word-click='enabled'>
                                                                        
                                                                        
                                                                                                
                                                                                                                        

    <div id="dictionary-entry-1" class="entry-word-section-container">

                                            <span data-hom="1" class="anchor-name ga-track-hom" id="h1-anchor"></span>
    
    <span id="dictionary-entry-1-anchor"></span>

    
    
<div class="row entry-header">
    <div class="col-12">
        <div class="entry-header-content d-flex flex-wrap align-items-baseline flex-row mb-0">
                                    <h1 class="hword">fantasy</h1>
                            <span><span class="badge entry-numbers-badge fw-normal position-relative mt-3 me-4">1 of 3</span></span>
            
                                            <h2 class="parts-of-speech"><a class="important-blue-link" href="/dictionary/noun">noun</a></h2>                    </div>

                    <div class="row entry-attr mb-3 mt-2">
                <div class="col word-syllables-prons-header-content flex-wrap">
                                                                                                                            <!-- TODO: syllables entry word content - commenting out for now -->
                                                            <span class="word-syllables-entry">fanÂ·&#8203;taÂ·&#8203;sy</span>
                    
                                                                                                              <span class="prons-entries-list-inline mb-1">

              <div class="sense has-sn has-num-only">
        <span class="sn"></span>
    <div class="sense-content w-100">
                                          <span class="dt hasSdSense">
              
          
                                                      <span class="dtText"><strong class="mw_t_bc">: </strong>the power or process of creating especially unrealistic or improbable mental images in response to psychological need</span>                                      
              
                             <div class="sub-content-thread mb-3"><span class="ex-sent  first-child no-aq sents">an object of <span class="mw_t_wi">fantasy</span></span><div class="thread-anchor"></div></div>                         
                </span>
                                
<div class="sdsense">
            <span class="sd">also</span>                
          
                                                      <span class="dtText"><strong class="mw_t_bc">: </strong>a mental image or a series of mental images (such as a daydream) so created </span>                                      
              
                             <div class="sub-content-thread mb-3"><span class="ex-sent  first-child no-aq sents">sexual <em class="mw_t_it">fantasies</em>    </span><div class="thread-anchor"></div></div>

                    <span class="lozenge color-4">vision                </a>
                            </li>
                                <li class="dictionary-synonyms-item">
                <a class="syn-link" lang="en" href="/dictionary/fantasize">
                    <span class="lozenge color-4">fantasize                </a>
                            </li>
            </ul>
                                                                            <div class="d-grid gap-2 mt-4">
                            <a class="btn mw-btn-outline-orange position-relative" href="/thesaurus/fantasy">See All Synonyms &amp; Antonyms in Thesaurus</a>
                        </div>
                    </div>

          <span class="sub-content-thread ex-sent  first-child t no-aq sents">
      <span class="thread-anchor"></span>
      <span class="d-block thread-anchor-content pb-1">
         
                        His plans are pure <em class="mw_t_it">fantasy</em>.      </span>
    </span>
  
                    


          <span class="sub-content-thread ex-sent  first-child t no-aq sents">
      <span class="thread-anchor"></span>
      <span class="d-block thread-anchor-content pb-1">
         
                        He can hardly tell the difference between <em class="mw_t_it">fantasy</em> and reality.      </span>
    </span>
  
                    


          <span class="sub-content-thread ex-sent  first-child t no-aq sents">

    </span>

      <span class="thread-anchor"></span>
      <span class="d-block thread-anchor-content pb-1">
         
                        Her <em class="mw_t_it">fantasy</em> is to be a film star.      </span>
    </span>

                                                            <div id="word-history" class="widget content-section-with-header word-history">
                            <div id="word-history-anchor"></div>
                            <div class="content-section-header">
                                <h2>Word History</h2>
                            </div>
                            <div class="content-section-body">
                                                                    <div class="etymology-content-section">
                                        <div class="content-section-sub-header">Etymology</div>
                                                                                                                                    <p class="function-label">Noun</p>
                        <p class="et">
                Middle English <em class="mw_t_it">fantasie, fantsy, fansey</em> &quot;the imagination as a faculty, mental image produced by this faculty, deluded notion, figment of the imagination, preference directed by caprice rather than reason, liking,&quot; borrowed from Anglo-French <em class="mw_t_it">fantasie</em> &quot;imagination as a faculty, figment of the imagination, dizziness,&quot; borrowed from Late Latin <em class="mw_t_it">phantasia</em> &quot;imagination as a faculty, mental image of something perceived physically, image evoked by a poet or orator, a thing imagined by someone sleeping or ill, delusion,&quot; going back to Latin, &quot;imagined situation or experience,&quot; borrowed from Greek <em class="mw_t_it">phantasÃ­a</em> &quot;appearance, presentation to consciousness (whether immediate or in memory), image, imagination as a faculty, imagery,&quot; noun derivative corresponding to <em class="mw_t_it">phantÃ¡zein</em> &quot;to make visible, present to the eye or mind, (middle voice) place before one's mind, picture to oneself, imagine,&quot; causative verb from <em class="mw_t_it">phantÃ³s</em> &quot;visible,&quot; verbal adjective of <em class="mw_t_it">phaÃ­nÅ, phaÃ­nein</em> (active voice) &quot;to bring to light, cause to appear,&quot; and <em class="mw_t_it">phaÃ­nomai, phaÃ­nesthai</em> (middle voice) &quot;to become visible, come to light, appear,&quot; going back to <em class="mw_t_it">*phan-iÌ¯e/o-,</em> thematized from Indo-European <em class="mw_t_it">*b<sup>h</sup>-nÃ©-h<sub>2</sub>-/b<sup>h</sup>-nÌ¥-h<sub>2</sub>-</em> (whence also Armenian <em class="mw_t_it">banam</em> &quot;(I) open, reveal&quot;), nasal present from <em class="mw_t_it">*b<sup>h</sup>eh<sub>2</sub>-</em> &quot;shine, give light, appear,&quot; whence Sanskrit <em class="mw_t_it">bhÄÌti</em> &quot;(it) shines, beams,&quot; Avestan <em class="mw_t_it">fra-uuÄiti</em> &quot;(it) beams forth&quot;; the verb is allied to nominal derivatives in <em class="mw_t_it">-n-,</em> as Germanic <em class="mw_t_it">*bÅnjan-</em> (whence Old English <em class="mw_t_it">bÅn</em> &quot;ornament,&quot; <em class="mw_t_it">gebÅned</em> &quot;ornamented,&quot; Middle Dutch <em class="mw_t_it">boenen</em> &quot;to scrub, polish&quot;), Old Irish <em class="mw_t_it">bÃ¡n</em> &quot;white, fair, bright,&quot; Tocharian B <em class="mw_t_it">peÃ±iyo</em> &quot;splendor,&quot; Sanskrit <em class="mw_t_it">bhÄnÃº-</em> &quot;light, beam, brilliance, appearance,&quot; Avestan <em class="mw_t_it">bÄnu-</em> &quot;beam of light&quot;            </p>
                                    <p class="et_snote ps-0">
                
<span class="note-txt text-uppercase">Note:</span>
    Compare <a href = "/dictionary/fancy#h2" class = 'mw_t_et_link'>fancy <span class='text-lowercase'>entry</span> 2</a>, in Middle English a rare variant of <em class="mw_t_it">fantasie</em>; the two split from each other in early Modern English, so that <a href = "/dictionary/fancy#h2" class = 'mw_t_et_link'>fancy <span class='text-lowercase'>entry</span> 2</a> and <em class="mw_t_it">fantasy</em> now differ in meaning and construction. In the sixteenth and seventeenth centuries a not infrequent sense, usually with the spelling <em class="mw_t_it">phantasy,</em> was &quot;the formation of images or representations in direct perception or in memory,&quot; more or less following the Greek meaning. â Regarding the relation of <em class="mw_t_it">*b<sup>h</sup>eh<sub>2</sub>-</em> &quot;shine, give light, appear&quot; to the homonymous base <em class="mw_t_it">*b<sup>h</sup>eh<sub>2</sub>-</em> &quot;speak, say,&quot; see note at <a href = "/dictionary/ban#h1" class = 'mw_t_et_link'>ban <span class='text-lowercase'>entry</span> 1</a>.            </p>
                                                                                                                                                <p class="function-label">Adjective</p>
                        <p class="et">
                from attributive use of <a href = "/dictionary/fantasy#h1" class = 'mw_t_et_link'>fantasy <span class='text-lowercase'>entry</span> 1</a>            </p>
                                                                                                                                                <p class="function-label">Verb</p>
                        <p class="et">
                Middle English <em class="mw_t_it">fantasien, fantesien, fancyen</em> &quot;to plan, devise, create, form (an idea), imagine (something false), desire&quot;  â more at <a href = "/dictionary/fancy#h1" class = 'mw_t_mat'>fancy <span class='text-lowercase'>entry</span> 1</a>            </p>
                                    <p class="et_snote ps-0">
                
<span class="note-txt text-uppercase">Note:</span>
    The word was originally a variant of <a href = "/dictionary/fancy#h1" class = 'mw_t_et_link'>fancy <span class='text-lowercase'>entry</span> 1</a>, which, together with the more recent derivative <a href = "/dictionary/fantasize" class = 'mw_t_et_link'>fantasize</a>, has in large part supplanted it.            </p>
                                                                                        </div>
                                
                                                                                                    <div class="first-known-content-section">
                                        <div class="content-section-sub-header">First Known Use</div>
                                                                                        <p class="function-label">Noun</p>
<p class="ety-sl pb-3" data-entry-id="1">14th century, in the meaning defined at <a href="#h1">sense 6</a></p>                                                                                        <p class="function-label">Adjective</p>
<p class="ety-sl pb-3" data-entry-id="2">1984, in the meaning defined <a href="#h2">above</a></p>                                                                                        <p class="function-label">Verb</p>
<p class="ety-sl pb-3" data-entry-id="3">15th century, in the meaning defined <a href="#h3">above</a></p>                                                                            </div>
                                                                                                    <div class="time-travel-content-section">
                                        <div class="content-section-sub-header">Time Traveler</div>
                                        <span class="text-strong">The first known use of <em>fantasy</em> was 
                                        in the 14th century</span>
                                        <div>
                                            <a class="see-more" href="/time-traveler/14th-century?src=defrecirc-timetraveler-etycard">See more words from the same century</a>

<div class="row entry-header">

                                                                                <!-- TODO: syllables entry word content - commenting out for now -->

</div>




        <div class="row headword-row header-vrs">
        <div class="col">
            <span class="entry-attr vrs"><span class="badge mw-badge-gray-100 text-start text-wrap d-inline">variants</span>  
<span><span class="vl"> also </span><span id="phantasy-anchor" class="va">phantasy</span>        <div class="prons-entries-list d-inline align-items-center">
                                                                                <a class="play-pron-v2 text-decoration-none prons-entry-list-item d-inline-block badge mw-badge-gray-300" data-lang="en_us" data-file="phant01m" data-dir="p" href="/dictionary/fantasy?pronunciation&lang=en_us&dir=p&amp;file=phant01m" data-url="https://www.merriam-webster.com/dictionary/fantasy?pronunciation&lang=en_us&dir=p&amp;file=phant01m" data-title="How to pronounce fantasy (audio)" title="How to pronounce fantasy (audio)">Ëfant-É-sÄ&nbsp;<img class="svg" src="/dist-cross-dungarees/2025-12-17--20-05-47-dv1zk/images/svg/audio-pron-redesign.svg" alt="How to pronounce fantasy (audio)"></a>
                                                                                             <a class="play-pron-v2 text-decoration-none prons-entry-list-item d-inline-block badge mw-badge-gray-300" data-lang="en_us" data-file="phant02m" data-dir="p" href="/dictionary/fantasy?pronunciation&lang=en_us&dir=p&amp;file=phant02m" data-url="https://www.merriam-webster.com/dictionary/fantasy?pronunciation&lang=en_us&dir=p&amp;file=phant02m" data-title="How to pronounce fantasy (audio)" title="How to pronounce fantasy (audio)">-zÄ&nbsp;<img class="svg" src="/dist-cross-dungarees/2025-12-17--20-05-47-dv1zk/images/svg/audio-pron-redesign.svg" alt="How to pronounce fantasy (audio)"></a>
                        </div>
</span></span>
        </div>
    </div>
  
          <div class="row headword-row header-ins">
        <div class="col">
            <span class="vg-ins">
              <span class="il  il-badge badge mw-badge-gray-100"> plural&#32;</span><span class="if">fantasies</span>            </span>
        </div>
    </div>
  
          

    
    
        
                
                
                
        
                                                    
<div class="vg">
                            <div  class="vg-sseq-entry-item ">
                                        <div class="sb no-sn ms-lg-4 ms-3 w-100">
      <div class="sb-0 sb-entry">
              <div class="sense  no-subnum">
      <div class="sense-content w-100">
                                <span class="dt hasSdSense">
              
          
                                                      <span class="dtText"><strong class="mw_t_bc">: </strong>the power or process of creating especially unrealistic or improbable mental images in response to psychological need</span>                                      
              
                             <div class="sub-content-thread mb-3"><span class="ex-sent  first-child no-aq sents">an object of <span class="mw_t_wi">fantasy</span></span><div class="thread-anchor"></div></div>                         
                </span>
                                
<div class="sdsense">
            <span class="sd">also</span>                
          
                                                      <span class="dtText"><strong class="mw_t_bc">: </strong>a mental image or a series of mental images (as a daydream) so created </span>                                      
              
                             <div class="sub-content-thread mb-3"><span class="ex-sent  first-child no-aq sents">sexual <em class="mw_t_it">fantasies</em> of adolescence    </span><div class="thread-anchor"></div></div>                         
            </div>            </div>
</div>          </div>

        </svg>
      </a>
      <h4 class="wotd-side__title margin-t-0p9375em fs-6 m-0 p-0 mt-3">

                                                                                <div role="img" data-background-image-set="url(https://merriam-webster.com/assets/mw/images/omni/omni-4x3-457x343/alt-5d13dcf6840b1-6600-800e281ab13c1e54bd97dcc5d0f171ee@1x.jpg) 1x, url(https://merriam-webster.com/assets/mw/images/omni/omni-4x3-457x343/alt-5d13dcf6840b1-6600-800e281ab13c1e54bd97dcc5d0f171ee@2x.jpg) 2x" aria-label="alt-5d13dcf6840b1" class="lazyload-container lazyload ratio-4-3" style="opacity: 1; background-size: cover; background-position: center; background-repeat: no-repeat;"></div>                                    </div>
                                    <div class="teaser-content-box">
                                                                                    <h3 class="teaser-title">'Buck Naked' or 'Butt Naked'?</h3>
                                                                                                                    </div>
                                </div>
                            </a>
                        </div>

<script>
const setVWOConsentState = (state) => {
    window.VWO = window.VWO || [];
    window.VWO.init = window.VWO.init ||
        function (state) {
            window.VWO.consentState = state;
        };
    console.log('setting vwo consent state', state);
    window.VWO.init(state);
};
const updateVWOStatusGDPR = () => {
  const cmpConsentStatus = window?.__cmp('consentStatus');
  const consentExists = cmpConsentStatus?.consentExists;
  const cmpData = window?.__cmp('getCMPData');
  const vwoVendorId = 's31';

  if (consentExists) {
    if (cmpData?.vendorConsents?.[vwoVendorId]) {
      setVWOConsentState(1);
    } else {
      setVWOConsentState(3);
    }
  } else {
    setVWOConsentState(2);
  }
};

if (window.needsCmp === true) {
    const checkCmpAndAddListener = () => {
        if (window.__cmp) {
            window.__cmp('addEventListener', ['consent', updateVWOStatusGDPR, false], null);
                        updateVWOStatusGDPR();
            return true;
        }
        return false;
    };
    if (!checkCmpAndAddListener()) {
        const cmpCheckInterval = setInterval(() => {
            if (checkCmpAndAddListener()) {
                clearInterval(cmpCheckInterval);
            }
        }, 100);
                setTimeout(() => {
            clearInterval(cmpCheckInterval);
        }, 10000);
    }
} else {
        setVWOConsentState(1);
}
</script>

              <script>
(function() {
  // Make these global as plausible uses them
  window.getCookie = function(name) {
    const value = `; ${document.cookie}`;
    const parts = value.split(`; ${name}=`);
    if (parts.length === 2) return parts.pop().split(';').shift();
  }
  window.setCookie = function(name, value, days, isSecure) {
    const d = new Date();
    d.setTime(d.getTime() + 24 * 60 * 60 * 1000 * days);
    let cookieStr = name + "=" + value + ";path=/;SameSite=Lax;expires=" + d.toGMTString();
    if (isSecure) {
      cookieStr += ";secure";
    }
    document.cookie = cookieStr;
  }

  try {
    let mw8hxid = getCookie('mw8hxid');
    if (!mw8hxid) {
      mw8hxid = Math.random().toString().slice(2, 21);
      setCookie('mw8hxid', mw8hxid, 365, window.mwdata && window.mwdata.ENV !== 'sandbox');
    }

    const consumerPercent = parseInt(mw8hxid.slice(-2), 10);

    if (window.mwdata && Array.isArray(window.mwdata.AB_C_EXPERIMENTS)) {
      const exps = {};
      for (const exp of window.mwdata.AB_C_EXPERIMENTS) {
        if (consumerPercent >= exp.percentages_start && consumerPercent < exp.percentages_end) {
          exps[exp.ab_exp_name] = exp.ab_leg;
        }
      }

      if (Object.keys(exps).length > 0) {
        window.dataLayer = window.dataLayer || [];
        window.dataLayer.push({
          event: 'internalAbSetUserProperties',
          user_properties: exps
        });

        // Let's also make AB legs available as js variables
        window.mwdata.int_ab_exps = exps;
      } else {
        if (typeof Sentry !== 'undefined' && typeof Sentry.captureMessage === 'function') {
          Sentry.captureMessage('err: mwdata.AB_C_EXPERIMENTS, exps are empty');
        }
      }
    } else {
      if (typeof Sentry !== 'undefined' && typeof Sentry.captureMessage === 'function') {
        Sentry.captureMessage('err: mwdata.AB_C_EXPERIMENTS are not found');
      }
    }
  } catch (e) {
    if (typeof Sentry !== 'undefined' && typeof Sentry.captureException === 'function') {
      Sentry.captureException(e);
    }
  }
})();
</script>

  if (window.mwdata.importModules === undefined) {
    window.mwdata.importModules  = [];

    menu.gamesSubmenuOpen = false;

        <div class="left-content col position-relative overflow-hidden" id="left-content" data-word-click='enabled'>
                                                                        
                                                                        
                                                                                                
                                                                                                                        

    <div id="dictionary-entry-1" class="entry-word-section-container">

                                            <span data-hom="1" class="anchor-name ga-track-hom" id="h1-anchor"></span>
    
    <span id="dictionary-entry-1-anchor"></span>

    
    
<div class="row entry-header">
    <div class="col-12">
        <div class="entry-header-content d-flex flex-wrap align-items-baseline flex-row mb-0">
                                    <h1 class="hword">fantasy</h1>
                            <span><span class="badge entry-numbers-badge fw-normal position-relative mt-3 me-4">1 of 3</span></span>
            
                                            <h2 class="parts-of-speech"><a class="important-blue-link" href="/dictionary/noun">noun</a></h2>                    </div>

                    <div class="row entry-attr mb-3 mt-2">
                <div class="col word-syllables-prons-header-content flex-wrap">
                                                                                                                            <!-- TODO: syllables entry word content - commenting out for now -->
                                                            <span class="word-syllables-entry">fanÂ·&#8203;taÂ·&#8203;sy</span>
                    
                                                                                                              <span class="prons-entries-list-inline mb-1">

              <div class="sense has-sn has-num-only">
        <span class="sn"></span>
    <div class="sense-content w-100">
                                          <span class="dt hasSdSense">
              
          
                                                      <span class="dtText"><strong class="mw_t_bc">: </strong>the power or process of creating especially unrealistic or improbable mental images in response to psychological need</span>                                      
              
                             <div class="sub-content-thread mb-3"><span class="ex-sent  first-child no-aq sents">an object of <span class="mw_t_wi">fantasy</span></span><div class="thread-anchor"></div></div>                         
                </span>
                                
<div class="sdsense">
            <span class="sd">also</span>                
          
                                                      <span class="dtText"><strong class="mw_t_bc">: </strong>a mental image or a series of mental images (such as a daydream) so created </span>                                      
              
                             <div class="sub-content-thread mb-3"><span class="ex-sent  first-child no-aq sents">sexual <em class="mw_t_it">fantasies</em>    </span><div class="thread-anchor"></div></div>

                    <span class="lozenge color-4">vision                </a>
                            </li>
                                <li class="dictionary-synonyms-item">
                <a class="syn-link" lang="en" href="/dictionary/fantasize">
                    <span class="lozenge color-4">fantasize                </a>
                            </li>
            </ul>
                                                                            <div class="d-grid gap-2 mt-4">
                            <a class="btn mw-btn-outline-orange position-relative" href="/thesaurus/fantasy">See All Synonyms &amp; Antonyms in Thesaurus</a>
                        </div>
                    </div>

          <span class="sub-content-thread ex-sent  first-child t no-aq sents">
      <span class="thread-anchor"></span>
      <span class="d-block thread-anchor-content pb-1">
         
                        His plans are pure <em class="mw_t_it">fantasy</em>.      </span>
    </span>
  
                    


          <span class="sub-content-thread ex-sent  first-child t no-aq sents">
      <span class="thread-anchor"></span>
      <span class="d-block thread-anchor-content pb-1">
         
                        He can hardly tell the difference between <em class="mw_t_it">fantasy</em> and reality.      </span>
    </span>
  
                    


          <span class="sub-content-thread ex-sent  first-child t no-aq sents">

    </span>

      <span class="thread-anchor"></span>
      <span class="d-block thread-anchor-content pb-1">
         
                        Her <em class="mw_t_it">fantasy</em> is to be a film star.      </span>
    </span>

                                                            <div id="word-history" class="widget content-section-with-header word-history">
                            <div id="word-history-anchor"></div>
                            <div class="content-section-header">
                                <h2>Word History</h2>
                            </div>
                            <div class="content-section-body">
                                                                    <div class="etymology-content-section">
                                        <div class="content-section-sub-header">Etymology</div>
                                                                                                                                    <p class="function-label">Noun</p>
                        <p class="et">
                Middle English <em class="mw_t_it">fantasie, fantsy, fansey</em> &quot;the imagination as a faculty, mental image produced by this faculty, deluded notion, figment of the imagination, preference directed by caprice rather than reason, liking,&quot; borrowed from Anglo-French <em class="mw_t_it">fantasie</em> &quot;imagination as a faculty, figment of the imagination, dizziness,&quot; borrowed from Late Latin <em class="mw_t_it">phantasia</em> &quot;imagination as a faculty, mental image of something perceived physically, image evoked by a poet or orator, a thing imagined by someone sleeping or ill, delusion,&quot; going back to Latin, &quot;imagined situation or experience,&quot; borrowed from Greek <em class="mw_t_it">phantasÃ­a</em> &quot;appearance, presentation to consciousness (whether immediate or in memory), image, imagination as a faculty, imagery,&quot; noun derivative corresponding to <em class="mw_t_it">phantÃ¡zein</em> &quot;to make visible, present to the eye or mind, (middle voice) place before one's mind, picture to oneself, imagine,&quot; causative verb from <em class="mw_t_it">phantÃ³s</em> &quot;visible,&quot; verbal adjective of <em class="mw_t_it">phaÃ­nÅ, phaÃ­nein</em> (active voice) &quot;to bring to light, cause to appear,&quot; and <em class="mw_t_it">phaÃ­nomai, phaÃ­nesthai</em> (middle voice) &quot;to become visible, come to light, appear,&quot; going back to <em class="mw_t_it">*phan-iÌ¯e/o-,</em> thematized from Indo-European <em class="mw_t_it">*b<sup>h</sup>-nÃ©-h<sub>2</sub>-/b<sup>h</sup>-nÌ¥-h<sub>2</sub>-</em> (whence also Armenian <em class="mw_t_it">banam</em> &quot;(I) open, reveal&quot;), nasal present from <em class="mw_t_it">*b<sup>h</sup>eh<sub>2</sub>-</em> &quot;shine, give light, appear,&quot; whence Sanskrit <em class="mw_t_it">bhÄÌti</em> &quot;(it) shines, beams,&quot; Avestan <em class="mw_t_it">fra-uuÄiti</em> &quot;(it) beams forth&quot;; the verb is allied to nominal derivatives in <em class="mw_t_it">-n-,</em> as Germanic <em class="mw_t_it">*bÅnjan-</em> (whence Old English <em class="mw_t_it">bÅn</em> &quot;ornament,&quot; <em class="mw_t_it">gebÅned</em> &quot;ornamented,&quot; Middle Dutch <em class="mw_t_it">boenen</em> &quot;to scrub, polish&quot;), Old Irish <em class="mw_t_it">bÃ¡n</em> &quot;white, fair, bright,&quot; Tocharian B <em class="mw_t_it">peÃ±iyo</em> &quot;splendor,&quot; Sanskrit <em class="mw_t_it">bhÄnÃº-</em> &quot;light, beam, brilliance, appearance,&quot; Avestan <em class="mw_t_it">bÄnu-</em> &quot;beam of light&quot;            </p>
                                    <p class="et_snote ps-0">
                
<span class="note-txt text-uppercase">Note:</span>
    Compare <a href = "/dictionary/fancy#h2" class = 'mw_t_et_link'>fancy <span class='text-lowercase'>entry</span> 2</a>, in Middle English a rare variant of <em class="mw_t_it">fantasie</em>; the two split from each other in early Modern English, so that <a href = "/dictionary/fancy#h2" class = 'mw_t_et_link'>fancy <span class='text-lowercase'>entry</span> 2</a> and <em class="mw_t_it">fantasy</em> now differ in meaning and construction. In the sixteenth and seventeenth centuries a not infrequent sense, usually with the spelling <em class="mw_t_it">phantasy,</em> was &quot;the formation of images or representations in direct perception or in memory,&quot; more or less following the Greek meaning. â Regarding the relation of <em class="mw_t_it">*b<sup>h</sup>eh<sub>2</sub>-</em> &quot;shine, give light, appear&quot; to the homonymous base <em class="mw_t_it">*b<sup>h</sup>eh<sub>2</sub>-</em> &quot;speak, say,&quot; see note at <a href = "/dictionary/ban#h1" class = 'mw_t_et_link'>ban <span class='text-lowercase'>entry</span> 1</a>.            </p>
                                                                                                                                                <p class="function-label">Adjective</p>
                        <p class="et">
                from attributive use of <a href = "/dictionary/fantasy#h1" class = 'mw_t_et_link'>fantasy <span class='text-lowercase'>entry</span> 1</a>            </p>
                                                                                                                                                <p class="function-label">Verb</p>
                        <p class="et">
                Middle English <em class="mw_t_it">fantasien, fantesien, fancyen</em> &quot;to plan, devise, create, form (an idea), imagine (something false), desire&quot;  â more at <a href = "/dictionary/fancy#h1" class = 'mw_t_mat'>fancy <span class='text-lowercase'>entry</span> 1</a>            </p>
                                    <p class="et_snote ps-0">
                
<span class="note-txt text-uppercase">Note:</span>
    The word was originally a variant of <a href = "/dictionary/fancy#h1" class = 'mw_t_et_link'>fancy <span class='text-lowercase'>entry</span> 1</a>, which, together with the more recent derivative <a href = "/dictionary/fantasize" class = 'mw_t_et_link'>fantasize</a>, has in large part supplanted it.            </p>
                                                                                        </div>
                                
                                                                                                    <div class="first-known-content-section">
                                        <div class="content-section-sub-header">First Known Use</div>
                                                                                        <p class="function-label">Noun</p>
<p class="ety-sl pb-3" data-entry-id="1">14th century, in the meaning defined at <a href="#h1">sense 6</a></p>                                                                                        <p class="function-label">Adjective</p>
<p class="ety-sl pb-3" data-entry-id="2">1984, in the meaning defined <a href="#h2">above</a></p>                                                                                        <p class="function-label">Verb</p>
<p class="ety-sl pb-3" data-entry-id="3">15th century, in the meaning defined <a href="#h3">above</a></p>                                                                            </div>
                                                                                                    <div class="time-travel-content-section">
                                        <div class="content-section-sub-header">Time Traveler</div>
                                        <span class="text-strong">The first known use of <em>fantasy</em> was 
                                        in the 14th century</span>
                                        <div>
                                            <a class="see-more" href="/time-traveler/14th-century?src=defrecirc-timetraveler-etycard">See more words from the same century</a>

<div class="row entry-header">

                                                                                <!-- TODO: syllables entry word content - commenting out for now -->

</div>




        <div class="row headword-row header-vrs">
        <div class="col">
            <span class="entry-attr vrs"><span class="badge mw-badge-gray-100 text-start text-wrap d-inline">variants</span>  
<span><span class="vl"> also </span><span id="phantasy-anchor" class="va">phantasy</span>        <div class="prons-entries-list d-inline align-items-center">
                                                                                <a class="play-pron-v2 text-decoration-none prons-entry-list-item d-inline-block badge mw-badge-gray-300" data-lang="en_us" data-file="phant01m" data-dir="p" href="/dictionary/fantasy?pronunciation&lang=en_us&dir=p&amp;file=phant01m" data-url="https://www.merriam-webster.com/dictionary/fantasy?pronunciation&lang=en_us&dir=p&amp;file=phant01m" data-title="How to pronounce fantasy (audio)" title="How to pronounce fantasy (audio)">Ëfant-É-sÄ&nbsp;<img class="svg" src="/dist-cross-dungarees/2025-12-17--20-05-47-dv1zk/images/svg/audio-pron-redesign.svg" alt="How to pronounce fantasy (audio)"></a>
                                                                                             <a class="play-pron-v2 text-decoration-none prons-entry-list-item d-inline-block badge mw-badge-gray-300" data-lang="en_us" data-file="phant02m" data-dir="p" href="/dictionary/fantasy?pronunciation&lang=en_us&dir=p&amp;file=phant02m" data-url="https://www.merriam-webster.com/dictionary/fantasy?pronunciation&lang=en_us&dir=p&amp;file=phant02m" data-title="How to pronounce fantasy (audio)" title="How to pronounce fantasy (audio)">-zÄ&nbsp;<img class="svg" src="/dist-cross-dungarees/2025-12-17--20-05-47-dv1zk/images/svg/audio-pron-redesign.svg" alt="How to pronounce fantasy (audio)"></a>
                        </div>
</span></span>
        </div>
    </div>
  
          <div class="row headword-row header-ins">
        <div class="col">
            <span class="vg-ins">
              <span class="il  il-badge badge mw-badge-gray-100"> plural&#32;</span><span class="if">fantasies</span>            </span>
        </div>
    </div>
  
          

    
    
        
                
                
                
        
                                                    
<div class="vg">
                            <div  class="vg-sseq-entry-item ">
                                        <div class="sb no-sn ms-lg-4 ms-3 w-100">
      <div class="sb-0 sb-entry">
              <div class="sense  no-subnum">
      <div class="sense-content w-100">
                                <span class="dt hasSdSense">
              
          
                                                      <span class="dtText"><strong class="mw_t_bc">: </strong>the power or process of creating especially unrealistic or improbable mental images in response to psychological need</span>                                      
              
                             <div class="sub-content-thread mb-3"><span class="ex-sent  first-child no-aq sents">an object of <span class="mw_t_wi">fantasy</span></span><div class="thread-anchor"></div></div>                         
                </span>
                                
<div class="sdsense">
            <span class="sd">also</span>                
          
                                                      <span class="dtText"><strong class="mw_t_bc">: </strong>a mental image or a series of mental images (as a daydream) so created </span>                                      
              
                             <div class="sub-content-thread mb-3"><span class="ex-sent  first-child no-aq sents">sexual <em class="mw_t_it">fantasies</em> of adolescence    </span><div class="thread-anchor"></div></div>                         
            </div>            </div>
</div>          </div>

        </svg>
      </a>
      <h4 class="wotd-side__title margin-t-0p9375em fs-6 m-0 p-0 mt-3">

                                                                                <div role="img" data-background-image-set="url(https://merriam-webster.com/assets/mw/images/omni/omni-4x3-457x343/alt-5d13dcf6840b1-6600-800e281ab13c1e54bd97dcc5d0f171ee@1x.jpg) 1x, url(https://merriam-webster.com/assets/mw/images/omni/omni-4x3-457x343/alt-5d13dcf6840b1-6600-800e281ab13c1e54bd97dcc5d0f171ee@2x.jpg) 2x" aria-label="alt-5d13dcf6840b1" class="lazyload-container lazyload ratio-4-3" style="opacity: 1; background-size: cover; background-position: center; background-repeat: no-repeat;"></div>                                    </div>
                                    <div class="teaser-content-box">
                                                                                    <h3 class="teaser-title">'Buck Naked' or 'Butt Naked'?</h3>
                                                                                                                    </div>
                                </div>
                            </a>
                        </div>

<script>
const setVWOConsentState = (state) => {
    window.VWO = window.VWO || [];
    window.VWO.init = window.VWO.init ||
        function (state) {
            window.VWO.consentState = state;
        };
    console.log('setting vwo consent state', state);
    window.VWO.init(state);
};
const updateVWOStatusGDPR = () => {
  const cmpConsentStatus = window?.__cmp('consentStatus');
  const consentExists = cmpConsentStatus?.consentExists;
  const cmpData = window?.__cmp('getCMPData');
  const vwoVendorId = 's31';

  if (consentExists) {
    if (cmpData?.vendorConsents?.[vwoVendorId]) {
      setVWOConsentState(1);
    } else {
      setVWOConsentState(3);
    }
  } else {
    setVWOConsentState(2);
  }
};

if (window.needsCmp === true) {
    const checkCmpAndAddListener = () => {
        if (window.__cmp) {
            window.__cmp('addEventListener', ['consent', updateVWOStatusGDPR, false], null);
                        updateVWOStatusGDPR();
            return true;
        }
        return false;
    };
    if (!checkCmpAndAddListener()) {
        const cmpCheckInterval = setInterval(() => {
            if (checkCmpAndAddListener()) {
                clearInterval(cmpCheckInterval);
            }
        }, 100);
                setTimeout(() => {
            clearInterval(cmpCheckInterval);
        }, 10000);
    }
} else {
        setVWOConsentState(1);
}
</script>

              <script>
(function() {
  // Make these global as plausible uses them
  window.getCookie = function(name) {
    const value = `; ${document.cookie}`;
    const parts = value.split(`; ${name}=`);
    if (parts.length === 2) return parts.pop().split(';').shift();
  }
  window.setCookie = function(name, value, days, isSecure) {
    const d = new Date();
    d.setTime(d.getTime() + 24 * 60 * 60 * 1000 * days);
    let cookieStr = name + "=" + value + ";path=/;SameSite=Lax;expires=" + d.toGMTString();
    if (isSecure) {
      cookieStr += ";secure";
    }
    document.cookie = cookieStr;
  }

  try {
    let mw8hxid = getCookie('mw8hxid');
    if (!mw8hxid) {
      mw8hxid = Math.random().toString().slice(2, 21);
      setCookie('mw8hxid', mw8hxid, 365, window.mwdata && window.mwdata.ENV !== 'sandbox');
    }

    const consumerPercent = parseInt(mw8hxid.slice(-2), 10);

    if (window.mwdata && Array.isArray(window.mwdata.AB_C_EXPERIMENTS)) {
      const exps = {};
      for (const exp of window.mwdata.AB_C_EXPERIMENTS) {
        if (consumerPercent >= exp.percentages_start && consumerPercent < exp.percentages_end) {
          exps[exp.ab_exp_name] = exp.ab_leg;
        }
      }

      if (Object.keys(exps).length > 0) {
        window.dataLayer = window.dataLayer || [];
        window.dataLayer.push({
          event: 'internalAbSetUserProperties',
          user_properties: exps
        });

        // Let's also make AB legs available as js variables
        window.mwdata.int_ab_exps = exps;
      } else {
        if (typeof Sentry !== 'undefined' && typeof Sentry.captureMessage === 'function') {
          Sentry.captureMessage('err: mwdata.AB_C_EXPERIMENTS, exps are empty');
        }
      }
    } else {
      if (typeof Sentry !== 'undefined' && typeof Sentry.captureMessage === 'function') {
        Sentry.captureMessage('err: mwdata.AB_C_EXPERIMENTS are not found');
      }
    }
  } catch (e) {
    if (typeof Sentry !== 'undefined' && typeof Sentry.captureException === 'function') {
      Sentry.captureException(e);
    }
  }
})();
</script>

  if (window.mwdata.importModules === undefined) {
    window.mwdata.importModules  = [];

    menu.gamesSubmenuOpen = false;

        <div class="left-content col position-relative overflow-hidden" id="left-content" data-word-click='enabled'>
                                                                        
                                                                        
                                                                                                
                                                                                                                        

    <div id="dictionary-entry-1" class="entry-word-section-container">

                                            <span data-hom="1" class="anchor-name ga-track-hom" id="h1-anchor"></span>
    
    <span id="dictionary-entry-1-anchor"></span>

    
    
<div class="row entry-header">
    <div class="col-12">
        <div class="entry-header-content d-flex flex-wrap align-items-baseline flex-row mb-0">
                                    <h1 class="hword">fantasy</h1>
                            <span><span class="badge entry-numbers-badge fw-normal position-relative mt-3 me-4">1 of 3</span></span>
            
                                            <h2 class="parts-of-speech"><a class="important-blue-link" href="/dictionary/noun">noun</a></h2>                    </div>

                    <div class="row entry-attr mb-3 mt-2">
                <div class="col word-syllables-prons-header-content flex-wrap">
                                                                                                                            <!-- TODO: syllables entry word content - commenting out for now -->
                                                            <span class="word-syllables-entry">fanÂ·&#8203;taÂ·&#8203;sy</span>
                    
                                                                                                              <span class="prons-entries-list-inline mb-1">

              <div class="sense has-sn has-num-only">
        <span class="sn"></span>
    <div class="sense-content w-100">
                                          <span class="dt hasSdSense">
              
          
                                                      <span class="dtText"><strong class="mw_t_bc">: </strong>the power or process of creating especially unrealistic or improbable mental images in response to psychological need</span>                                      
              
                             <div class="sub-content-thread mb-3"><span class="ex-sent  first-child no-aq sents">an object of <span class="mw_t_wi">fantasy</span></span><div class="thread-anchor"></div></div>                         
                </span>
                                
<div class="sdsense">
            <span class="sd">also</span>                
          
                                                      <span class="dtText"><strong class="mw_t_bc">: </strong>a mental image or a series of mental images (such as a daydream) so created </span>                                      
              
                             <div class="sub-content-thread mb-3"><span class="ex-sent  first-child no-aq sents">sexual <em class="mw_t_it">fantasies</em>    </span><div class="thread-anchor"></div></div>

                    <span class="lozenge color-4">vision                </a>
                            </li>
                                <li class="dictionary-synonyms-item">
                <a class="syn-link" lang="en" href="/dictionary/fantasize">
                    <span class="lozenge color-4">fantasize                </a>
                            </li>
            </ul>
                                                                            <div class="d-grid gap-2 mt-4">
                            <a class="btn mw-btn-outline-orange position-relative" href="/thesaurus/fantasy">See All Synonyms &amp; Antonyms in Thesaurus</a>
                        </div>
                    </div>

          <span class="sub-content-thread ex-sent  first-child t no-aq sents">
      <span class="thread-anchor"></span>
      <span class="d-block thread-anchor-content pb-1">
         
                        His plans are pure <em class="mw_t_it">fantasy</em>.      </span>
    </span>
  
                    


          <span class="sub-content-thread ex-sent  first-child t no-aq sents">
      <span class="thread-anchor"></span>
      <span class="d-block thread-anchor-content pb-1">
         
                        He can hardly tell the difference between <em class="mw_t_it">fantasy</em> and reality.      </span>
    </span>
  
                    


          <span class="sub-content-thread ex-sent  first-child t no-aq sents">

    </span>

      <span class="thread-anchor"></span>
      <span class="d-block thread-anchor-content pb-1">
         
                        Her <em class="mw_t_it">fantasy</em> is to be a film star.      </span>
    </span>

                                                            <div id="word-history" class="widget content-section-with-header word-history">
                            <div id="word-history-anchor"></div>
                            <div class="content-section-header">
                                <h2>Word History</h2>
                            </div>
                            <div class="content-section-body">
                                                                    <div class="etymology-content-section">
                                        <div class="content-section-sub-header">Etymology</div>
                                                                                                                                    <p class="function-label">Noun</p>
                        <p class="et">
                Middle English <em class="mw_t_it">fantasie, fantsy, fansey</em> &quot;the imagination as a faculty, mental image produced by this faculty, deluded notion, figment of the imagination, preference directed by caprice rather than reason, liking,&quot; borrowed from Anglo-French <em class="mw_t_it">fantasie</em> &quot;imagination as a faculty, figment of the imagination, dizziness,&quot; borrowed from Late Latin <em class="mw_t_it">phantasia</em> &quot;imagination as a faculty, mental image of something perceived physically, image evoked by a poet or orator, a thing imagined by someone sleeping or ill, delusion,&quot; going back to Latin, &quot;imagined situation or experience,&quot; borrowed from Greek <em class="mw_t_it">phantasÃ­a</em> &quot;appearance, presentation to consciousness (whether immediate or in memory), image, imagination as a faculty, imagery,&quot; noun derivative corresponding to <em class="mw_t_it">phantÃ¡zein</em> &quot;to make visible, present to the eye or mind, (middle voice) place before one's mind, picture to oneself, imagine,&quot; causative verb from <em class="mw_t_it">phantÃ³s</em> &quot;visible,&quot; verbal adjective of <em class="mw_t_it">phaÃ­nÅ, phaÃ­nein</em> (active voice) &quot;to bring to light, cause to appear,&quot; and <em class="mw_t_it">phaÃ­nomai, phaÃ­nesthai</em> (middle voice) &quot;to become visible, come to light, appear,&quot; going back to <em class="mw_t_it">*phan-iÌ¯e/o-,</em> thematized from Indo-European <em class="mw_t_it">*b<sup>h</sup>-nÃ©-h<sub>2</sub>-/b<sup>h</sup>-nÌ¥-h<sub>2</sub>-</em> (whence also Armenian <em class="mw_t_it">banam</em> &quot;(I) open, reveal&quot;), nasal present from <em class="mw_t_it">*b<sup>h</sup>eh<sub>2</sub>-</em> &quot;shine, give light, appear,&quot; whence Sanskrit <em class="mw_t_it">bhÄÌti</em> &quot;(it) shines, beams,&quot; Avestan <em class="mw_t_it">fra-uuÄiti</em> &quot;(it) beams forth&quot;; the verb is allied to nominal derivatives in <em class="mw_t_it">-n-,</em> as Germanic <em class="mw_t_it">*bÅnjan-</em> (whence Old English <em class="mw_t_it">bÅn</em> &quot;ornament,&quot; <em class="mw_t_it">gebÅned</em> &quot;ornamented,&quot; Middle Dutch <em class="mw_t_it">boenen</em> &quot;to scrub, polish&quot;), Old Irish <em class="mw_t_it">bÃ¡n</em> &quot;white, fair, bright,&quot; Tocharian B <em class="mw_t_it">peÃ±iyo</em> &quot;splendor,&quot; Sanskrit <em class="mw_t_it">bhÄnÃº-</em> &quot;light, beam, brilliance, appearance,&quot; Avestan <em class="mw_t_it">bÄnu-</em> &quot;beam of light&quot;            </p>
                                    <p class="et_snote ps-0">
                
<span class="note-txt text-uppercase">Note:</span>
    Compare <a href = "/dictionary/fancy#h2" class = 'mw_t_et_link'>fancy <span class='text-lowercase'>entry</span> 2</a>, in Middle English a rare variant of <em class="mw_t_it">fantasie</em>; the two split from each other in early Modern English, so that <a href = "/dictionary/fancy#h2" class = 'mw_t_et_link'>fancy <span class='text-lowercase'>entry</span> 2</a> and <em class="mw_t_it">fantasy</em> now differ in meaning and construction. In the sixteenth and seventeenth centuries a not infrequent sense, usually with the spelling <em class="mw_t_it">phantasy,</em> was &quot;the formation of images or representations in direct perception or in memory,&quot; more or less following the Greek meaning. â Regarding the relation of <em class="mw_t_it">*b<sup>h</sup>eh<sub>2</sub>-</em> &quot;shine, give light, appear&quot; to the homonymous base <em class="mw_t_it">*b<sup>h</sup>eh<sub>2</sub>-</em> &quot;speak, say,&quot; see note at <a href = "/dictionary/ban#h1" class = 'mw_t_et_link'>ban <span class='text-lowercase'>entry</span> 1</a>.            </p>
                                                                                                                                                <p class="function-label">Adjective</p>
                        <p class="et">
                from attributive use of <a href = "/dictionary/fantasy#h1" class = 'mw_t_et_link'>fantasy <span class='text-lowercase'>entry</span> 1</a>            </p>
                                                                                                                                                <p class="function-label">Verb</p>
                        <p class="et">
                Middle English <em class="mw_t_it">fantasien, fantesien, fancyen</em> &quot;to plan, devise, create, form (an idea), imagine (something false), desire&quot;  â more at <a href = "/dictionary/fancy#h1" class = 'mw_t_mat'>fancy <span class='text-lowercase'>entry</span> 1</a>            </p>
                                    <p class="et_snote ps-0">
                
<span class="note-txt text-uppercase">Note:</span>
    The word was originally a variant of <a href = "/dictionary/fancy#h1" class = 'mw_t_et_link'>fancy <span class='text-lowercase'>entry</span> 1</a>, which, together with the more recent derivative <a href = "/dictionary/fantasize" class = 'mw_t_et_link'>fantasize</a>, has in large part supplanted it.            </p>
                                                                                        </div>
                                
                                                                                                    <div class="first-known-content-section">
                                        <div class="content-section-sub-header">First Known Use</div>
                                                                                        <p class="function-label">Noun</p>
<p class="ety-sl pb-3" data-entry-id="1">14th century, in the meaning defined at <a href="#h1">sense 6</a></p>                                                                                        <p class="function-label">Adjective</p>
<p class="ety-sl pb-3" data-entry-id="2">1984, in the meaning defined <a href="#h2">above</a></p>                                                                                        <p class="function-label">Verb</p>
<p class="ety-sl pb-3" data-entry-id="3">15th century, in the meaning defined <a href="#h3">above</a></p>                                                                            </div>
                                                                                                    <div class="time-travel-content-section">
                                        <div class="content-section-sub-header">Time Traveler</div>
                                        <span class="text-strong">The first known use of <em>fantasy</em> was 
                                        in the 14th century</span>
                                        <div>
                                            <a class="see-more" href="/time-traveler/14th-century?src=defrecirc-timetraveler-etycard">See more words from the same century</a>

<div class="row entry-header">

                                                                                <!-- TODO: syllables entry word content - commenting out for now -->

</div>




        <div class="row headword-row header-vrs">
        <div class="col">
            <span class="entry-attr vrs"><span class="badge mw-badge-gray-100 text-start text-wrap d-inline">variants</span>  
<span><span class="vl"> also </span><span id="phantasy-anchor" class="va">phantasy</span>        <div class="prons-entries-list d-inline align-items-center">
                                                                                <a class="play-pron-v2 text-decoration-none prons-entry-list-item d-inline-block badge mw-badge-gray-300" data-lang="en_us" data-file="phant01m" data-dir="p" href="/dictionary/fantasy?pronunciation&lang=en_us&dir=p&amp;file=phant01m" data-url="https://www.merriam-webster.com/dictionary/fantasy?pronunciation&lang=en_us&dir=p&amp;file=phant01m" data-title="How to pronounce fantasy (audio)" title="How to pronounce fantasy (audio)">Ëfant-É-sÄ&nbsp;<img class="svg" src="/dist-cross-dungarees/2025-12-17--20-05-47-dv1zk/images/svg/audio-pron-redesign.svg" alt="How to pronounce fantasy (audio)"></a>
                                                                                             <a class="play-pron-v2 text-decoration-none prons-entry-list-item d-inline-block badge mw-badge-gray-300" data-lang="en_us" data-file="phant02m" data-dir="p" href="/dictionary/fantasy?pronunciation&lang=en_us&dir=p&amp;file=phant02m" data-url="https://www.merriam-webster.com/dictionary/fantasy?pronunciation&lang=en_us&dir=p&amp;file=phant02m" data-title="How to pronounce fantasy (audio)" title="How to pronounce fantasy (audio)">-zÄ&nbsp;<img class="svg" src="/dist-cross-dungarees/2025-12-17--20-05-47-dv1zk/images/svg/audio-pron-redesign.svg" alt="How to pronounce fantasy (audio)"></a>
                        </div>
</span></span>
        </div>
    </div>
  
          <div class="row headword-row header-ins">
        <div class="col">
            <span class="vg-ins">
              <span class="il  il-badge badge mw-badge-gray-100"> plural&#32;</span><span class="if">fantasies</span>            </span>
        </div>
    </div>
  
          

    
    
        
                
                
                
        
                                                    
<div class="vg">
                            <div  class="vg-sseq-entry-item ">
                                        <div class="sb no-sn ms-lg-4 ms-3 w-100">
      <div class="sb-0 sb-entry">
              <div class="sense  no-subnum">
      <div class="sense-content w-100">
                                <span class="dt hasSdSense">
              
          
                                                      <span class="dtText"><strong class="mw_t_bc">: </strong>the power or process of creating especially unrealistic or improbable mental images in response to psychological need</span>                                      
              
                             <div class="sub-content-thread mb-3"><span class="ex-sent  first-child no-aq sents">an object of <span class="mw_t_wi">fantasy</span></span><div class="thread-anchor"></div></div>                         
                </span>
                                
<div class="sdsense">
            <span class="sd">also</span>                
          
                                                      <span class="dtText"><strong class="mw_t_bc">: </strong>a mental image or a series of mental images (as a daydream) so created </span>                                      
              
                             <div class="sub-content-thread mb-3"><span class="ex-sent  first-child no-aq sents">sexual <em class="mw_t_it">fantasies</em> of adolescence    </span><div class="thread-anchor"></div></div>                         
            </div>            </div>
</div>          </div>

        </svg>
      </a>
      <h4 class="wotd-side__title margin-t-0p9375em fs-6 m-0 p-0 mt-3">

                                                                                <div role="img" data-background-image-set="url(https://merriam-webster.com/assets/mw/images/omni/omni-4x3-457x343/alt-5d13dcf6840b1-6600-800e281ab13c1e54bd97dcc5d0f171ee@1x.jpg) 1x, url(https://merriam-webster.com/assets/mw/images/omni/omni-4x3-457x343/alt-5d13dcf6840b1-6600-800e281ab13c1e54bd97dcc5d0f171ee@2x.jpg) 2x" aria-label="alt-5d13dcf6840b1" class="lazyload-container lazyload ratio-4-3" style="opacity: 1; background-size: cover; background-position: center; background-repeat: no-repeat;"></div>                                    </div>
                                    <div class="teaser-content-box">
                                                                                    <h3 class="teaser-title">'Buck Naked' or 'Butt Naked'?</h3>
                                                                                                                    </div>
                                </div>
                            </a>
                        </div>
